definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: A new reentry guidance algorithm for RLV(reusable launching vehicle) is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种针对可重复使用运载器的再入制导算法。

sentences.english: Space Shuttle's reentry is one of the relatively complicated procedure of the entire flight procedure.
sentences.chinese: 航天飞机再入段是整个飞行过程中较为复杂的阶段。

sentences.english: Both ballistic and maneuvering re-entries are considered.
sentences.chinese: 考虑了弹道式再入和机动再入两种情况。

sentences.english: In this paper, the guidance scheme of reentry vehicles attacking slowly moving targets on the sea is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了再入飞行器攻击海上慢速活动目标的制导方案。

sentences.english: The autonomy and attacking accuracy of the missile can be increased at reentry stage.
sentences.chinese: 用以提高导弹再入段的自主性和射击精度。

definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
to repeat/to follow the same road as
to return/to go back/to come back
grain/granule/classifier for small round things (peas, bullets, peanuts, pills, grains etc)
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
